title: 114_hr4134
content: The "Veterans Health Care Staffing Improvement Act" establishes a program to enhance recruitment and hiring of health care workers transitioning from the armed forces by the Department of Veterans Affairs. The "Docs-to-Doctors Program" is a recruitment initiative for individuals transitioning from the Armed Forces who served in a health care capacity. The Secretary of Defense will provide a list of eligible members to the Secretary of Veterans Affairs annually. The Secretary of Defense will provide a list of eligible members annually who are transitioning from the Armed Forces and served in a health care capacity. The list will include members undergoing separation or discharged under honorable conditions, with specific occupational codes. The Secretary of Defense will provide contact information, rank upon separation, and health care experience for eligible members transitioning from the Armed Forces. The Secretary of Defense will consult with the Secretary of Homeland Security when submitting the list. The Defense Department will consult with the Secretary of Homeland Security regarding Coast Guard matters. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs, in coordination with the Secretary of Defense, will address barriers to employment for individuals transitioning from the Armed Forces, particularly in health care roles. This includes resolving credentialing issues and hiring processes between the Departments of Veterans Affairs and Defense. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will submit a report to Congress with recommendations to resolve barriers to employment for transitioning Armed Forces members, including those in health care roles. Applications for employment in the Department of Veterans Affairs from these individuals will receive special consideration. Applications for employment in the Department of Veterans Affairs from transitioning Armed Forces members will receive special consideration if submitted within one year of separation. SEC. 3. UNIFORM CREDENTIALING STANDARDS FOR CERTAIN HEALTH CARE PROFESSIONALS OF THE DEPARTMENT OF VETERANS AFFAIRS. The Secretary shall implement a uniform credentialing process for employees of the Veterans Health Administration in specified positions. Credentialed employees can practice in any location within the Administration, with provisions for renewal of credentials. The Secretary may renew credentials under this section with regulations as prescribed. Renewal may not be required if an employee changes facilities. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs must implement a uniform credentialing process within one year. Full practice authority is provided for advanced practice registered nurses, physician assistants, and other healthcare professionals in the Department of Veterans Affairs. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs grants full practice authority to advanced practice registered nurses, physician assistants, and other licensed healthcare professionals within the Department of Veterans Affairs, regardless of state limitations on their practice. The term "full practice authority" for advanced practice registered nurses and physician assistants refers to the full scope of practice determined by their respective national professional associations or organizations. The term "physician assistant" refers to the full scope of practice determined by the national professional association or organization. The term "physician assistant" refers to the full scope of practice as defined in section 1861(aa)(5)(A) of the Social Security Act.
